name: Juggernaut
clue: The Juggernaut wants you to download this file and get the flag.

name: Doppler
clue: queen dopplepopolis ðŸ‘‘

name: Small Hashes Anyways
clue: Micro hashes for micro blaze Â¯\\\_(ãƒ„)\_/Â¯

name: Ominous Etude
clue:
we didn't start the fire

you'll want `microblaze-linux.tar.bz2` from "small hashes anyways"

name: The Wrath of Khan
clue:
You thought Khan was defeated and you were safe. Wrong! He messed with the hardware on the Genesis probe and now its going to crash. Can you patch the software so that it safely lands on Seti-Beta VII.
Seti-Beta VII is an M class planet with:

Radius: 13120 km

Gravitational Constant: 2527105.1264 (km^3/s^2)

name: Blazin' Etudes
clue:
it was always burning since the world's been turning

you'll *need* the `microblaze-linux.tar.bz2` file from "Small Hashes Anyways"

name: Power Level
clue:
"What does the scouter say about their power level?"

Waitâ€¦ you got angry and crushed your scouter. Go make a new one.

name: Welcome to the Spiderverse
clue: We're using encryption so this FPGA is definitely secure!

name: Power Point
clue:
Break out Microsoft Office because its time to make some slidesâ€¦ just kidding!

There is a satellite out there transmitting a flag. You are on a moving platform and you don't know how you will be moving or where the transmitter is or how the transmitter is moving. Luckily you have a steerable antenna! To get the flag:

1. Find the transmitter by steering the antenna.
2. Keep the antenna pointed at the transmitter and try to maximize signal power.
3. Decode the samples coming in from your receiver.

Your co-worker told you they think the satellites is "North-ish and sort of close to the horizon"

Send `az`, `el` commands to the antenna; an antenna command is formatted as a string for example if az=77.1 and el=73.2 

send:
```
77.10,22.2\n
```

Please send one command at a time.

After you send a command the receiver will reply with a fixed number of IQ samples via TCP.

name: Space Jam
clue:
It's a noisy world out there and you just want to transmit from your satellite. Use the transmitter controls to transmit the flag to yourself. Make sure you receive the flag before the transmission window ends.

Configure your signal with a JSON command using the following format:

```
{"frequency":100000,   "constellation":"PSK",   "samples_per_symbol":1000,    "diff_encoding":"OFF","amplitude":100.0}
```

name: (Don't) Fly Me to the Moon
clue:
An old rocket booster is about to crash in to the Galactic Mining And Tunneling (GMAT) corporation's Lunar space mining operation! Fortunately we've attached a robotic servicing module to it with some limited deltaV. Figure out the maneuvers needed to bring the booster safely to the Earth-Moon L4 Lagrange point. Make sure the booster stays there for a while until we figure out what to do with it.


Note: The viewer will not update with your trajectory until after you finish sending maneuvers, the default trajectory in there when the challenge starts isnt worth looking at.

name: Black Hole
clue:
We found a satellite but we can't speak its language. It changes its ~~encryption~~ encoding every time we open a connection... 

We've got an open connection to the satellite.

It sent us this encoded message. Decode it and send it back to get the flag.

name: Matters of State
clue:
I wasn't paying attention in today's Keplerian orbit mechanics class. Who wants to do my homework for me?

note: It will ask you the same question a few time (randomization is busted). Just keep answering and you'll be good.

name: The Authenticator Equivalence Principle
clue:
We were so worried about this satellite that we made every contact begin with multi-factor authentication. 
We recently reset the keys and reset the synchronization but now we can't access the satellite.

The engineer who wrote our MFA app was part of the great resignation and didn't believe in git.

We found these files on his shared drive though.

name: Crosslinks
clue: Who am i?

name: Navigation Rebooting
clue:
You're getting into the small satellite constellation game, but it's a crowded world up there!

One of your satellites got hit by some space junk.

* The GPS receiver was damaged and it isn't working.
* The satellite has rebooted.
* The intersatellite ranging and communication system rebooted but is working.
* Solve your position and velocity to re-initialize the navigation system.

name: Leggo My Steggo!
clue:
We've been running this satellite that has the same command mnemonic as an old Hack-a-Sat 2020 satellite - but now its infected with something.

In our last communication it dumped out all these files.

Re-gain authority over the satellite

The satellite seems to still respond to the commands mnemonics we used before but replies in a strange way.

[https://github.com/cromulencellc/hackasat-final-2020/tree/master/solvers/c4/solver_ruby_scripts](https://github.com/cromulencellc/hackasat-final-2020/tree/master/solvers/c4/solver_ruby_scripts)

name: F'DA Approved Beef
clue:
The F'DA has hidden the beef in flight software on its new satellite.

Connect to the system and find our beef. 

We are starting to get hungry.

name: Screaming Fist
clue: Operation Screaming Fist is underway and Col. Willis Corto needs your support in bypassing ICE and acquiring sensitive intelligence. Attack the satellite, steal the data we need and help us end this cyberwar!

name: Magneto
clue: Repeat after Magneto to get the flag

name: Prof. X
clue: Solve the professor's problem to get the flag

name: Once Unop a Djikstar
clue:
Great, the fancy new Starlunk constellation won't route my packets  anymore, right before our big trip.
 
The StarlunkHacks forum thread had a sketchy looking binary. Might as well download that before we leave.

Why did I think working on my honeymoon was a good idea...

name: Stars Above
clue:
Starlunk has been nothing but trouble since I subscribed. Those hackers really did a number on things.

Maybe we can force the system to route our traffic better. Work smarter not harder right?

name: Red Alert
clue:
Someone is junking up our orbits again.
We've upgraded the space lasers from HAS2 to the new Femptosecond Laser Automated Gun system. Now you dont need to tell the lasers where to fire, you just need to activate the debris detection system and the lasers will automatically shoot down debris. Careful though, the debris detector and the lasers use a lot of power and generate a lot of heat!


Grafana has access to the API through our internal network. Available commands:

```
http://groundstation:5000/laser-on

http://groundstation:5000/laser-off

http://groundstation:5000/detector-on

http://groundstation:5000/detector-off

http://groundstation:5000/play
```

Use the `play` API command to start the game.

Grafana username: `admin`

Grafana password: `spacemath`

name: It's A Wrap
clue: Do you like inception?

name: Fun in the Sun
clue: Our solar panels are looking to get a good tan

name: Bit Flipper
clue:
We're trying to send our satellite a reset, but some bad guy flashed our reset module with a program to make it really difficult.

We were only able to recover the binary off their computer... Please help.
